node.title: Schools could be kept open with 'test to stay' approach instead of quarantine, Doherty Institute says
node.alt: A teacher sits on the flood in a classroom, showing three students writing.
node.description: A final report to government recommendsÂ using rapid antigen tests instead of quarantine for school children exposed to COVID-19 to safely limit the number of classroom teaching hours lost.
node.content:
["State and federal leaders have been told schools can safely stay open and children kept in class with a \"test to stay\" approach to preventing COVID-19 outbreaks in schools, rather than full quarantine.", "The Doherty Institute has delivered its final modelling to National Cabinet\u00a0and has told leaders that students should be able to safely keep going to school, even if one of their classmates catches COVID-19, by using daily rapid antigen testing to quickly catch and prevent outbreaks.", "The report found daily rapid antigen tests of children exposed to\u00a0a COVID case, with students sent home\u00a0only if they test\u00a0positive, is as effective for preventing outbreaks in schools as a full\u00a014-day quarantine, and \"dramatically reduces days of missed face to face learning\".", "The modelling found requiring classroom contacts to take rapid antigen tests to stay at school, compared to quarantining at home, resulted on average in just one more infection in primary schools, and six fewer in high schools.", "The Institute said in the absence of any form of screening or contact tracing at all, as many as 47 per cent of COVID \"incursions\" would die out without spreading to other children, in a school where at least 80 per cent of students are fully vaccinated.", "But a third of incursions would result in 20 or more infections, sometimes as many as 50, without any measures to detect and isolate positive cases.", "\"Twice weekly testing of students markedly increases the chances of nipping an outbreak in the bud,\"\u00a0the modellers said.", "\"There is a small increase in average school days lost because we are looking harder for infections and so detect asymptomatic individuals, but far fewer large outbreaks.", "The Institute said its findings were consistent with a real-world study comparing quarantine measures for school children with a \"test to stay\" approach in England.", "That study also strongly endorsed \"test to stay\" as a way to limit outbreaks while maintaining face-to-face teaching and open schools.", "
Increased risk of Delta to children, but hospitalisation still rare
", "The Doherty Institute also noted that while the Delta strain of the virus posed an increased risk to children, the odds of a child who catches COVID-19 requiring hospitalisation remains extremely rare.", "Concerns over how COVID-19 affected children grew significantly with the emergence of the Delta strain, which was more frequently infecting children than early strains.", "Institute modelling found the Delta strain made hospitalisation approximately twice as likely for young people\u00a0compared to early COVID-19 strains \u2014\u00a0but the incidence of hospitalisation is still only roughly one in 30 teenagers\u00a0\u2014 many who are hospitalised as a precaution."]
